meanings.definition: Lack of ability to express oneself clearly
meanings.sent1: Her inarticulacy in public speaking made her nervous.
meanings.sent2: The professor's inarticulacy confused the students.
meanings.sent3: Despite his inarticulacy, he managed to convey his emotions through music.
meanings.sent4: The inarticulacy of the painting left viewers puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The child's inarticulacy in describing the movie scene was adorable.

meanings.definition: State of being unable to communicate effectively
meanings.sent1: The team's inarticulacy during the meeting led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: His inarticulacy on the phone call caused frustration.
meanings.sent3: The inarticulacy of the mime artist brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The inarticulacy of the broken bridge symbolized the communication breakdown.
meanings.sent5: The inarticulacy of the old radio made it difficult to understand the news.
